SUMMARY: In presence of d-serine, D-serine deaminase protein, DsdC, activates transcription of genes involved in d-serine detoxification, and in absence of metabolite it is autorepressed [6296057]. DsbC belongs to LysR family of bacterial transcriptional regulators and contains a possible helix-turn-helix motif for DNA binding in C-terminal domain. This protein shows 50% similarity to GcvA protein [7592420, 3275618]. dsbC gene is located next to an operon ( dsdXA ) regulated by DsbC, but facing in opposite direction. activation effect of DsdC on this operon is enhanced by CRP, but CRP cannot act alone on operon [7592420]. A DNA-binding site recognized by dimer of DsbC has not been identified.
